featured-news.title: St Andrews named University of the year
featured-news.text: St Andrews is named UK University of the Year in The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2020.

news-updates.featured-title: Chemical elements which make up mobile phones placed on ‘endangered list’
news-updates.featured-content: Scientists from the University of St Andrews have developed a unique periodic table which highlights the scarcity of elements used in everyday devices such as smart phones and TVs.

news-updates-alternate.featured-title: Chemical elements which make up mobile phones placed on ‘endangered list’
news-updates-alternate.featured-content: Scientists from the University of St Andrews have developed a unique periodic table which highlights the scarcity of elements used in everyday devices such as smart phones and TVs.

secondary-update.secondary-content: World-renowned dementia expert Dr Maggie Ellis, from the University of St Andrews, is shortlisted as a finalist for Converge 2019, Scotland’s leading entrepreneurial development programme for Higher Education.
The role of the rat in the development of epidemiology is the subject of a new £990,164 research project at the University of St Andrews.

secondary-update.secondary-title: Students take part in traditional St Andrews Pier Walk
secondary-update.secondary-content: Hundreds of students take part in the traditional Pier Walk along the harbour wall of St Andrews before the start of the new academic year.

news-items.title: Apes possess human-like “theory of mind”
news-items.description: Apes understand what others see and believe, a skill previously believed to be unique to humans, according to new research.

news-items.title: Early diagnosis key to survival
news-items.description: A new institute has been created to help improve earlier diagnosis of cancer, cardiovascular disease, mental health and infection.

news-items.title: Climate change protest
news-items.description: Newly arrived Visiting Global Fellow, Glen MacDonald, was awestruck by the massive turnout in St Andrews for the Climate Change Strike.

news-items.title: Killing Strangers – How Violence Became Modern
news-items.description: Dr Tim Wilson takes a fresh look at the origins of our contemporary terrorism crisis in a lecture to mark the 25th anniversary of the CSTPV.

news-items.title: Ancient volcanoes reveal Earth’s recycled crust
news-items.description: Ancient volcanoes could provide new insights into how the Earth’s surface is recycled, according to St Andrews scientists.
